content: lupine hat about lupine blooming in all colors and spaces - a hapa knits pattern mountain hikes neighborhood gardens - is one of my favorite spring/summer sights this design was created in collaboration with colorado indie dyer delight ali pate of road trip sock yarn to showcase her signature speckles and range of colors directions with smaller needles and mc cast on 120 stitches using cast on method of choice i used german twisted cast on join in the round placing bor marker work in 3x2 rib knit 3 purl 2 around for 1 / 2 55cm switch to larger needles and join cc work chart from bottom to top and right to left *important note regarding decreases the final central double decrease cdd for each round straddles the bor marker meaning materials and general info that you will need to remove the marker as you knit the cdd and replace it once the knit in the round from the bottom up decrease is complete yarn fingering or sport weight after the final round of chart break both main color 200 yards yarns thread the tapestry needle with the contrast color 50 yards tail of mc and draw it through the remaining sample uses road trip sock yarn fingering loops on the needle pulling tightly to close weight the crown of the hat suggested needles us size 2 and 4 circulars finishing weave in ends and steam or wet block hat to finished measurements notions stitch marker tapestry needle gauge 24 st & 32 row = 4 / 10cm abbreviations bor beginning of round marker cc contrast color cdd central double decrease slip two stitches as if to k2 together knit one pass the slipped stitches over the knit stitch mc main color about the designer hapa knits patterns are designed by elena vetter patterns can be found on ravelry ravelry com/designer/hapa-knits on instagram @hapa knits if you re on ig i d love to see your work tag @hapa knits and #lupinehat and check out @roatripsockyarn for yarn inspo thank you so much for your support © 2025 by hapa knits chart key mc cc cdd
